direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the standard equals-hashCode contract and are often tested together to ensure consistency.
The equals method checks if two sets are equal by comparing their sizes and contents, similar to how the contains method checks for the presence of an element.
The equals method checks if all elements of one set are present in another, similar to how containsAll checks if all elements of a collection are present in the set.
The equals method relies on the size method to compare the sizes of the sets being compared.
The equals method may indirectly rely on the iterator method to traverse the elements of the set for comparison.
Both methods involve converting the set to another form (array in the case of toArray, and boolean result in the case of equals).
Similar to toArray(), this method also involves converting the set to an array, which can be compared structurally with the equals method.
The toSet method creates a new set that can be compared using the equals method, providing a way to test the equality of sets.
